noun.description: An even-toed ungulate mammal of a group that comprises the camels, llamas, and their extinct relatives. They are distinguished by bearing their weight on the sole-pads of the feet rather than on the hoofs, and they do not chew the cud.

origin: Late 19th century: from modern Latin Tylopoda, from Greek tulos knob or tulē callus, cushion + pous, pod- foot.
